title: Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) Therapy
description: High-concentration platelet injections that accelerate tissue repair, reduce pain, and restore mobility without drugs or surgery.
longDescription: PRP harnesses the healing components inside your own blood—platelets, growth factors, and cytokines—and concentrates them up to 6x baseline. When injected precisely into damaged joints, tendons, or ligaments, PRP sparks collagen production, calms inflammation, and strengthens tissue. At Dr. SNA Clinic we use dual-spin centrifuges, ultrasound guidance, and tailored rehab so every drop delivers results.

overview.title: Why PRP Works
overview.content: Platelets carry the growth factors that repair tissue after injury. We draw a small amount of blood, process it in a dual-spin centrifuge to isolate a pure platelet layer, and inject it under ultrasound guidance into the damaged area. Growth factors trigger collagen synthesis, recruit stem cells, and increase blood flow so healing accelerates naturally.
highlights: Autologous (your own blood) – zero rejection risk
Targets osteoarthritis, tendinopathy, ligament sprains, and post-surgery healing
Minimal downtime and no steroid side effects

faq.question: Does PRP hurt?
faq.answer: We use local anaesthetic, vibration therapy, and nitrous oxide if needed. Most patients feel only mild pressure.

faq.question: How soon can I exercise?
faq.answer: Gentle movement starts immediately. Higher impact or heavy lifting resumes after physio clearance, typically at 2-4 weeks.

faq.question: Can PRP be combined with other therapies?
faq.answer: Yes, we often combine PRP with shockwave, physiotherapy, or cellular injections for layered results.
